entries.meaning: (Wikimedia jargon, Internet slang) Of a user, account, or IP address: blocked or banned from editing or other actions for an indefinite length of time.
examples: While there's nothing wrong with imposing a topic ban on an indef editor who may one day be allowed back, it is a little unusual.

entries.meaning: (Wikimedia jargon, Internet slang) The action of blocking or banning a user, account, or IP address from editing or other actions for an indefinite length of time.
examples: An indef seems the only way to stem the flow of disruption from this user.

verbs.description: indef (third-person singular simple present indefs, present participle indeffing, simple past and past participle indeffed)

entries.meaning: (Wikimedia jargon, Internet slang) To block or ban a user, account, or IP address from editing or other actions for an indefinite length of time.
examples: I indeffed the editor based on the legal threat.
